name: Cyclamen
Relationship: Compare: AMBRA; PULSAT.; CINCHONA; FERR. CIT. ET. CHIN.

Eyes: Dim vision, worse on waking, with spots before eyes
Disturbance of vision, associated with gastric disturbances
Stomach: SALTY TASTE; hiccough-like eructation worse, fat food
Diarrhoea after every cup of coffee; HICCOUGH
Modalities: Better: rubbing parts; in warm room
Head: Terrors of conscience
Grieves over duty neglected
Depression, with weeping desire to be alone
Aching in morning, with FLICKERING BEFORE EYES; sneezing with itching in ear
Vertigo; things turn in a circle; better in the room; worse, open air
One-sided headache
Frequent sneezing with itching in ears
Female: Menses PROFUSE, BLACK, membranous, CLOTTED, TOO EARLY, WITH LABOR-LIKE PAINS from back to pubes
Menstrual irregularities with megrim and blindness, or fiery spots before eyes
Postpartum hemorrhage, with colicky bearing-down pains, with relief after gush of blood
After menses, swelling of breasts, with milky secretion
Skin: Acne in young women, pruritus better scratching and appearance of menses
Rectum: PAIN ABOUT ANUS AND PERINEUM, as if a spot were suppurating, when walking or sitting
Extremities: Pains in parts where bones lie near surface
Cramp-like contraction of right thumb and index finger

details: Large doses produce violent purging and vomiting; disturbed digestion with very salty saliva. Anaemic and chlorotic conditions. Affections of uterus. Gastrointestinal and genitourinary tracts affected, inducing secondary anaemia and various reflexes. SLEEPINESS, MOROSENESS, AND LASSITUDE. Cough at night while asleep without waking, especially in children. (CHAM.; NIT-AC.)
